intro.title: Deepening the Sea of Your Heart
description: Itâ€™s okay not to force the waves of anxiety to settle.
We cannot control the height of the waves, but we can make the depth of your inner sea even deeper.
Let's expand your sea now, creating a space where even the roughest waves can stay.
Through deep and calm breaths, meet the version of yourself that is much larger and deeper than any wave.
intro.contentDescription: This is a practice of breathing with the rhythm of the waves to deepen your capacity to accept anxiety.
steps: 1. As the wave rises, breathe in deeply and expand the sea of your heart.
2. As the wave falls, breathe out slowly and let the anxiety simply be there.
3. Beneath the rolling waves, feel the deep, unwavering sea that is 'you'.
intro.tip: Tip: Instead of pushing the waves away, imagine making your sea deeper so you can hold them gently within.

breath.hold: Hold your breath for a moment
breath.restart:
Shall we take another breath 
to settle our hearts?

result.title: The sea of your heart has grown deeper
description: Waves of anxiety sometimes find us, rolling in with great force.
We often try to stop or shrink those waves, but their size is not ours to decide.
Yet, within you lies a deep, vast sea that can hold these waves.
Instead of forcing the waves out, you've used your breath to make the sea where they stay even larger and deeper.
The waves may stay the same size, but your sea is now deep enough to hold any anxiety gently.
result.breathTime: You've spent {{seconds}} seconds deepening the sea of your heart.
